clusters.title: 10/11: CBS Weekend News
clusters.neutral_headline: Ceasefire in Gaza, Hostage Release, and Trump's Role

items.title: 10/11: CBS Weekend News
items.standfirst: Israelis credit President Trump with ceasefire deal, hostage release; Creative musicians turn trash to instruments and a landfill to theater.
items.content: Israelis credit President Trump with ceasefire deal, hostage release; Creative musicians turn trash to instruments and a landfill to theater.

items.title: Israelis praise Trump at huge rally ahead of expected hostage release by Hamas in Gaza
items.standfirst: Hundreds of thousands gather in Tel Aviv as Palestinians continue to return to Gaza City after the Israeli withdrawal.
items.content: Hundreds of thousands gather in Tel Aviv as Palestinians continue to return to Gaza City after the Israeli withdrawal.

items.title: Creative musicians turn trash to instruments and a landfill to theater
items.standfirst: North of San Francisco, a few dozen families flocked to a performance with instruments made from trash located at a dump. Anne Makovec has the story.
items.content: North of San Francisco, a few dozen families flocked to a performance with instruments made from trash located at a dump. Anne Makovec has the story.

items.title: Israelis credit President Trump with ceasefire deal, hostage release
items.standfirst: Israel anxiously awaits the return of the remaining hostages seized by Hamas 735 days ago. Thousands gathered in Tel Aviv's Hostage Square for what they hope is the last time. Among them, President Trump's daughter, Ivanka Trump, spoke to the crowd. Debora Patta has more.
items.content: Israel anxiously awaits the return of the remaining hostages seized by Hamas 735 days ago. Thousands gathered in Tel Aviv's Hostage Square for what they hope is the last time. Among them, President Trump's daughter, Ivanka Trump, spoke to the crowd. Debora Patta has more.

items.title: Israel prepares for final hostage release as Gazans return home
items.standfirst: With a ceasefire in effect, Israelis celebrated the anticipated return of hostages Saturday as Gazans returned home to devastation. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.
items.content: With a ceasefire in effect, Israelis celebrated the anticipated return of hostages Saturday as Gazans returned home to devastation. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.

items.title: More than 500,000 Palestinians return to ruined Gaza City as truce holds
items.standfirst: More than half a million displaced Palestinians have returned to Gaza City since a ceasefire came into effect Friday, Gaza's civil defence agency said on Saturday. Many displaced Palestinians returning home were left stunned by the destruction while others were amazed to find their homes still standing.
items.content: More than half a million displaced Palestinians have returned to Gaza City since a ceasefire came into effect Friday, Gaza's civil defence agency said on Saturday. Many displaced Palestinians returning home were left stunned by the destruction while others were amazed to find their homes still standing.

items.title: What we know about the Gaza ceasefire agreement
items.standfirst: Israeli troops have pulled back from parts of Gaza after Israel approved Donald Trump's ceasefire and hostage release plan.
items.content: Israeli troops have pulled back from parts of Gaza after Israel approved Donald Trump's ceasefire and hostage release plan.

items.title: Thousands of Gazans return home as ceasefire takes effect
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands of Palestinians headed back to the heavily destroyed northern Gaza Strip on Friday as a U.S.-brokered ceasefire came into effect in a deal that raised hopes for ending the Israel-Hamas war. All the remaining hostages were set to be released within days.
items.content: Tens of thousands of Palestinians headed back to the heavily destroyed northern Gaza Strip on Friday as a U.S.-brokered ceasefire came into effect in a deal that raised hopes for ending the Israel-Hamas war. All the remaining hostages were set to be released within days.

items.title: Palestinians return as Israeli troops pull back
items.standfirst: Thousands of Palestinians returned home after Israeli troops pulled back, as part of President Trump’s peace deal. Hamas is required to release its hostages by Monday. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.
items.content: Thousands of Palestinians returned home after Israeli troops pulled back, as part of President Trump’s peace deal. Hamas is required to release its hostages by Monday. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.

items.title: ‘It’s complete devastation’: Gazans return home to ruins
items.standfirst: Displaced civilians returned to a landscape of rubble and ruins in Khan Younis as the Gaza ceasefire came into effect. “No signs of life are left,” said one man. “Everything has been wiped out.”
items.content: Displaced civilians returned to a landscape of rubble and ruins in Khan Younis as the Gaza ceasefire came into effect. “No signs of life are left,” said one man. “Everything has been wiped out.”

items.title: Hamas praises Trump but says Tony Blair not welcome in post-war Gaza role – as it happened
items.standfirst: This blog is now closed. You can read our latest reporting here:Full report: Palestinians begin journey home as ceasefire comes into effectBlair, Kushner, Trump: who are the key people behind the Gaza ceasefire?‘I expect to find a ghost city’: Gaza residents on the long journey homeIsraeli military has said that the ceasefire agreement has come into effect, as troops have now retreated to the deployment lines agreed upon.In a statement released on Telegram, the IDF says troops “began positioning themselves along the updated deployment lines” from midday local time. Continue reading...
items.content: This blog is now closed. You can read our latest reporting here:Full report: Palestinians begin journey home as ceasefire comes into effectBlair, Kushner, Trump: who are the key people behind the Gaza ceasefire?‘I expect to find a ghost city’: Gaza residents on the long journey homeIsraeli military has said that the ceasefire agreement has come into effect, as troops have now retreated to the deployment lines agreed upon.In a statement released on Telegram, the IDF says troops “began positioning themselves along the updated deployment lines” from midday local time. Continue reading...

items.title: Palestinians displaced to southern Gaza begin journey home as ceasefire comes into effect
items.standfirst: Thousands walk north along coastal road after Israel-Hamas agreement puts stop to fighting for first time in six monthsTens of thousands of displaced Palestinians in Gaza have begun to return to the ruins of their homes after the ceasefire rapidly negotiated in recent days between Hamas and Israel came into effect at noon local time on Friday – the first relief from relentless violence that inhabitants of the devastated territory have had since March.Israeli troops withdrew to new agreed-upon positions during Friday morning and Hamas is expected to release the 20 living Israeli hostages it is holding early next week, after which Israel will free 250 Palestinians serving long-term sentences in Israeli prisons, as well as 1,700 others detained during the war. Continue reading...
items.content: Thousands walk north along coastal road after Israel-Hamas agreement puts stop to fighting for first time in six monthsTens of thousands of displaced Palestinians in Gaza have begun to return to the ruins of their homes after the ceasefire rapidly negotiated in recent days between Hamas and Israel came into effect at noon local time on Friday – the first relief from relentless violence that inhabitants of the devastated territory have had since March.Israeli troops withdrew to new agreed-upon positions during Friday morning and Hamas is expected to release the 20 living Israeli hostages it is holding early next week, after which Israel will free 250 Palestinians serving long-term sentences in Israeli prisons, as well as 1,700 others detained during the war. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Israelis celebrated the anticipated return of hostages after a ceasefire took effect on Saturday.
Thousands gathered in Tel Aviv's Hostage Square, including Ivanka Trump, awaiting the release.
More than 500,000 Palestinians returned to Gaza City after the ceasefire began.
Israeli troops pulled back from parts of Gaza after the ceasefire agreement was approved.
Creative musicians turned trash into instruments and performed at a landfill.

clusters.title: Watch: Tennessee town comes together to confront tragedy
clusters.neutral_headline: Tennessee Explosives Plant Explosion Claims Sixteen Lives

items.title: Watch: Tennessee town comes together to confront tragedy
items.standfirst: Authorities have confirmed that 16 people were killed when an explosives plant in rural Tennessee exploded on Friday morning.
items.content: Authorities have confirmed that 16 people were killed when an explosives plant in rural Tennessee exploded on Friday morning.

items.title: 16 people died in a blast at a Tennessee explosives factory early Friday, sheriff says
items.standfirst: A blast in rural Tennessee that leveled an explosives plant and was felt for miles around killed 16 people and left no survivors, authorities said.
items.content: A blast in rural Tennessee that leveled an explosives plant and was felt for miles around killed 16 people and left no survivors, authorities said.(Image credit: Obed Lamy)

items.title: 10/11: Saturday Morning
items.standfirst: 18 missing after blast at Tennessee military explosives plant; NYC staple Union Square Cafe marks 40 years in business
items.content: 18 missing after blast at Tennessee military explosives plant; NYC staple Union Square Cafe marks 40 years in business

items.title: No survivors after blast at Tennessee military explosives plant, sheriff says
items.standfirst: Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis confirmed 16 victims in the blast at a news conference on Saturday night.
items.content: Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis confirmed 16 victims in the blast at a news conference on Saturday night.

items.title: No survivors in Tennessee plant explosion, sheriff says
items.standfirst: It is unclear how many people were inside the Tennessee plant that exploded on Friday, but at least 16 people were reported on Saturday. Sheriff Chris Davis announced that there are no survivors. Nicole Valdes reports.
items.content: It is unclear how many people were inside the Tennessee plant that exploded on Friday, but at least 16 people were reported on Saturday. Sheriff Chris Davis announced that there are no survivors. Nicole Valdes reports.

items.title: No survivors found after Tennessee explosives plant blast
items.standfirst: With 18 people unaccounted for, the tragedy is "even more devastating than we thought", says a sheriff.
items.content: With 18 people unaccounted for, the tragedy is "even more devastating than we thought", says a sheriff.

items.title: At least 16 killed in blast at Tennessee explosives plant
items.standfirst: Officials say victims' families have been notified and that the cause of the blast is still not known.
items.content: Officials say victims' families have been notified and that the cause of the blast is still not known.

items.title: Sheriff says Tennessee explosives factory blast left no survivors
items.standfirst: A blast on Friday at the rural Tennessee Accurate Energetic Systems plant, which supplies and researches explosives for the military left no survivors, authorities said, adding that the 18 people inside the building are presumed to be deceased. State officials brought in a “rapid DNA” team to help identify the remains and said it could be days, weeks or even months before foul play is ruled out.
items.content: A blast on Friday at the rural Tennessee Accurate Energetic Systems plant, which supplies and researches explosives for the military left no survivors, authorities said, adding that the 18 people inside the building are presumed to be deceased. State officials brought in a “rapid DNA” team to help identify the remains and said it could be days, weeks or even months before foul play is ruled out.

items.title: No survivors in Tennessee explosives factory blast, officials say
items.standfirst: Initial toll after explosions at plant near McEwen on Friday was believed to be 19 people but later revised to 18.There were no survivors in the blast that obliterated part of an explosives factory in rural Tennessee, authorities said on Saturday.The families of 18 people had been waiting anxiously on Saturday as their loved ones had been feared dead since explosions ripped through the plant near McEwen in western Tennessee early on Friday. The initial toll had been believed to be 19 people but that figure was later revised. Continue reading...
items.content: Initial toll after explosions at plant near McEwen on Friday was believed to be 19 people but later revised to 18.There were no survivors in the blast that obliterated part of an explosives factory in rural Tennessee, authorities said on Saturday.The families of 18 people had been waiting anxiously on Saturday as their loved ones had been feared dead since explosions ripped through the plant near McEwen in western Tennessee early on Friday. The initial toll had been believed to be 19 people but that figure was later revised. Continue reading...

items.title: Blast at Tennessee explosives plant leaves dozens missing and feared dead
items.standfirst: A blast leveled an explosives plant Friday in rural Tennessee, leaving behind a mass of twisted metal, burned-out shells of cars and at least 18 people missing and feared dead, authorities said. “There’s nothing to describe. It’s gone,” Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis said of the blast site at Accurate Energetic Systems, which supplies and researches explosives for the military.
items.content: A blast leveled an explosives plant Friday in rural Tennessee, leaving behind a mass of twisted metal, burned-out shells of cars and at least 18 people missing and feared dead, authorities said. “There’s nothing to describe. It’s gone,” Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis said of the blast site at Accurate Energetic Systems, which supplies and researches explosives for the military.

ai_summary: An explosion at a Tennessee explosives plant killed 16 people, with no survivors found.
The blast leveled the plant and was felt for miles around the rural area.
Authorities confirmed the 16 victims and notified their families.
Officials brought in a "rapid DNA" team to help identify the remains.
The cause of the explosion is still unknown, and foul play is not ruled out.

items.standfirst: Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning actress known for memorable roles in films like “Annie Hall” and “The Godfather” trilogy, has died at the age of 79. NBC News’ Maggie Vespa has a look back at her remarkable career.

items.title: Academy Award-winning actress Diane Keaton dies at 79
items.standfirst: Actress Diane Keaton, known for her Oscar-winning performance in 1977's "Annie Hall" and her role in "The Godfather" films, has died at age 79, People magazine reported Saturday.
items.content: Actress Diane Keaton, known for her Oscar-winning performance in 1977's "Annie Hall" and her role in "The Godfather" films, has died at age 79, People magazine reported Saturday.

She was also a defender of historic buildings in Los Angeles.
Keaton's career included roles in "Reds" and other notable films.

Trump’s threat came after China unleashed a raft of export restrictions on rare earth minerals last week. The escalating tensions threaten to…

items.title: Trump’s new 100% tariffs on China triggered an $18 billion crypto sell-off

Digital currencies bitcoin, ether and solana were among the most affected cryptocurrencies, bringing total…

items.title: Trump fires back at China’s rare earth mineral restrictions by threatening 100% tariffs
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump declared Friday that he will impose a 100% tariff on all imports from China, while also imposing export controls on “any and all critical software” from the United States. This is the latest move in what looks like an escalating trade conflict between the United States and…

This is the latest move in what looks like an escalating trade conflict between the United States and…

items.title: Trump announces additional 100 percent tariff on Chinese imports
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump announced an additional 100 percent tariff on China Friday and threatened to cancel a summit with Xi Jinping, reigniting his trade war with Beijing in a row over export curbs on rare earth minerals. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson reports.
items.content: US President Donald Trump announced an additional 100 percent tariff on China Friday and threatened to cancel a summit with Xi Jinping, reigniting his trade war with Beijing in a row over export curbs on rare earth minerals. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson reports.

items.title: Trump threatens 100% China tariffs as Beijing restricts rare-earth exports
items.standfirst: President accuses China of ‘very hostile’ moves and says additional tariffs could come on 1 November ‘or sooner’Donald Trump has threatened to impose additional US tariffs of 100% on China starting next month, accusing Beijing of “very hostile” moves to restrict exports of rare earths needed for American industry.Wall Street fell sharply after the US president reignited public tensions with the Chinese government, and raised the prospect of another acrimonious trade war between the world’s two largest economies. Continue reading...
items.content: President accuses China of ‘very hostile’ moves and says additional tariffs could come on 1 November ‘or sooner’Donald Trump has threatened to impose additional US tariffs of 100% on China starting next month, accusing Beijing of “very hostile” moves to restrict exports of rare earths needed for American industry.Wall Street fell sharply after the US president reignited public tensions with the Chinese government, and raised the prospect of another acrimonious trade war between the world’s two largest economies. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump threatens additional 100% tariff on 'aggressive' China
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has announced the US will impose an additional 100% tariff on China imports, accusing it of taking an "extraordinarily aggressive position" on trade.
items.content: Donald Trump has announced the US will impose an additional 100% tariff on China imports, accusing it of taking an "extraordinarily aggressive position" on trade.

items.title: The World’s Chip Supply Chain Is Bracing for Fallout From China’s Rare-Earth Curbs
items.standfirst: Businesses across the global semiconductor supply chain are bracing themselves for disruptions from an escalating trade war, after China imposed curbs on rare-earth mineral exports and the US responded with additional tariffs and restrictions on software sales to the Asian nation.
items.content: Businesses across the global semiconductor supply chain are bracing themselves for disruptions from an escalating trade war, after China imposed curbs on rare-earth mineral exports and the US responded with additional tariffs and restrictions on software sales to the Asian nation.

ai_summary: China warned the US of countermeasures if Trump reimposes 100% tariffs on Chinese goods.
Trump threatened 100% tariffs on Chinese imports and export controls on US software.
China blamed the US for escalating the trade war and imposing restrictions.
Trump's tariff threat triggered an $18 billion crypto sell-off.
The world's chip supply chain is bracing for fallout from China's rare earth curbs.

clusters.title: Trump directs Pentagon to 'use all available funds' to pay troops during shutdown
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Directs Military Pay During Government Shutdown

items.title: Trump directs Pentagon to 'use all available funds' to pay troops during shutdown
items.standfirst: The president's directive would ensure US military personnel don't miss a scheduled paycheque next week.
items.content: The president's directive would ensure US military personnel don't miss a scheduled paycheque next week.

items.title: Trump directs Pentagon to use "all available funds" to pay troops amid shutdown
items.standfirst: The government shutdown entered its 11th day Saturday as Republicans and Democrats remain at an impasse over a spending plan, and the Trump administration began laying off thousands of federal workers.
items.content: The government shutdown entered its 11th day Saturday as Republicans and Democrats remain at an impasse over a spending plan, and the Trump administration began laying off thousands of federal workers.

items.title: Trump orders military troops to be paid amid government shutdown
items.standfirst: President Trump said Saturday that he was directing Defense Department officials to pay members of the military next week, despite the ongoing federal government shutdown. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin reports from the White House.
items.content: President Trump said Saturday that he was directing Defense Department officials to pay members of the military next week, despite the ongoing federal government shutdown. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin reports from the White House.

items.title: Trump directs Pentagon to use 'available funds' to pay military during shutdown
items.standfirst: President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues.
items.content: President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues. (Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

items.title: Trump says military members will be paid despite government shutdown
items.standfirst: President claims he found a way to pay troops and directed Pentagon chief to release funds on 15 OctoberDonald Trump claimed on Saturday that he had found a way to pay US military troops despite the ongoing federal government shutdown, saying he had instructed his defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, to release funds.Posting on his Truth Social platform, Trump wrote: “I am using my authority, as commander-in-chief, to direct our secretary of war, Pete Hegseth, to use all available funds to get our troops PAID on October 15.” Continue reading...
items.content: President claims he found a way to pay troops and directed Pentagon chief to release funds on 15 OctoberDonald Trump claimed on Saturday that he had found a way to pay US military troops despite the ongoing federal government shutdown, saying he had instructed his defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, to release funds.Posting on his Truth Social platform, Trump wrote: “I am using my authority, as commander-in-chief, to direct our secretary of war, Pete Hegseth, to use all available funds to get our troops PAID on October 15.” Continue reading...

items.title: Trump lays off thousands of US government workers amid govt shutdown
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump on Friday blamed Democrats for his decision to lay off thousands of workers across the US government as he followed through on his threat to cut the federal workforce during the government shutdown.
items.content: President Donald Trump on Friday blamed Democrats for his decision to lay off thousands of workers across the US government as he followed through on his threat to cut the federal workforce during the government shutdown.

ai_summary: Trump directed the Pentagon to use available funds to pay military personnel.
The government shutdown entered its 11th day, with Republicans and Democrats at an impasse.
Trump said he found a way to pay troops and instructed the Defense Secretary to release funds.
The announcement came days before active duty members would have missed their first paycheck.
Trump blamed Democrats for laying off thousands of US government workers.

clusters.title: Nobel Prize winner Machado says Venezuela is in 'chaos' under current regime
clusters.neutral_headline: Venezuelan Opposition Leader Wins Nobel Peace Prize

items.title: Nobel Prize winner Machado says Venezuela is in 'chaos' under current regime
items.standfirst: The far-right leader of Venezuela's opposition party said that the current president is illegitimate and called for his removal.
items.content: The far-right leader of Venezuela's opposition party said that the current president is illegitimate and called for his removal.(Image credit: Alfredo Lasry R)

items.title: For Trump world, the focus shifts to next year's Nobel Peace Prize
items.standfirst: The push to make President Donald Trump the winner of the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize began within hours of Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado winning.
items.content: The push to make President Donald Trump the winner of the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize began within hours of Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado winning.

items.title: Venezuelan politician María Corina Machado wins Nobel peace prize
items.standfirst: Opponent of Maduro regime receives award and praise for keeping ‘flame of democracy burning’The Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado has won the Nobel peace prize for her dogged struggle to rescue the South American country from its fate as “a brutal, authoritarian state”.Machado, 58, a conservative often described as Venezuela’s Iron Lady, has spent the last year living in hiding after her political movement was widely believed to have beaten the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, in the July 2024 presidential election. Continue reading...
items.content: Opponent of Maduro regime receives award and praise for keeping ‘flame of democracy burning’The Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado has won the Nobel peace prize for her dogged struggle to rescue the South American country from its fate as “a brutal, authoritarian state”.Machado, 58, a conservative often described as Venezuela’s Iron Lady, has spent the last year living in hiding after her political movement was widely believed to have beaten the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, in the July 2024 presidential election. Continue reading...

items.title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado
items.standfirst: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded Friday to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who lives in hiding after attempting to run for the presidency last year against President Nicolás Maduro
items.content: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded Friday to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who lives in hiding after attempting to run for the presidency last year against President Nicolás Maduro

ai_summary: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado won the Nobel Peace Prize.
Machado has been a vocal opponent of the Maduro regime.
She has been living in hiding after attempting to run for president.
The award recognizes her struggle to rescue Venezuela from authoritarianism.
The focus has shifted to the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize.

clusters.title: Madagascar soldiers join antigovernment protesters assembled in capital

items.title: Madagascar soldiers join antigovernment protesters assembled in capital

items.title: SNP backs Swinney’s ‘clear’ strategy for new independence referendum
items.standfirst: Members overwhelmingly endorse leadership motion that majority at next Holyrood election is only route to second voteSNP members have overwhelmingly backed leader John Swinney’s “clear and unambiguous” independence strategy that a majority election win is the only route to another referendum.On the first day of the party’s annual conference in Aberdeen, the vast majority of members backed the leadership’s motion that next May’s Holyrood elections should be fought on a “clear platform of national independence” and that winning a majority in the Scottish parliament – by securing 65 seats or more – would be “the only uncontested way to deliver a new vote on Scotland’s future”. Continue reading...
items.content: Members overwhelmingly endorse leadership motion that majority at next Holyrood election is only route to second voteSNP members have overwhelmingly backed leader John Swinney’s “clear and unambiguous” independence strategy that a majority election win is the only route to another referendum.On the first day of the party’s annual conference in Aberdeen, the vast majority of members backed the leadership’s motion that next May’s Holyrood elections should be fought on a “clear platform of national independence” and that winning a majority in the Scottish parliament – by securing 65 seats or more – would be “the only uncontested way to deliver a new vote on Scotland’s future”. Continue reading...
